list_definition.definition: a room for coats, hats etc.

list_ex_of_english: First, however, you are invited, maybe instructed is a better term, to deposit your coat at the extensive and unavoidable cloakrooms.
The project incorporates two new classrooms with a new main entrance, cloakroom and lavatories.
The public cloakrooms, bars and foyer spaces are both cramped and uncomfortable.
If one puts a bag in a cloakroom, one is subject to a number of conditions which one does not read.
Above the cloakroom is the bathroom, while the second floor at this end is attic.
They may be cloakroom attendants, catering workers or clerical workers working behind the scenes.
I will even throw in my personalised cloakroom hook for good measure.
Other men have been offered posts as cloakroom attendants.
